title: How to do an in-text citation for an APA paper? For example, I have a paragraph about some stuff and after the last sentence of it how do I cite where I got that information in APA format - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not familiar with “APA format”. But usually when a writer uses lifted material from another publication the paragraphs in question are typed in a distinct format from the rest of the essay. In addition, the paragraph may be indented. In addition a footnote is used to identify the original writer and publication. A * (or other symbol) is placed at the end of the quoted paragraph and a footnote at the bottom of the page states the author and publication to allow the reader to readily find the original material.

Four suggestions: Ask your instructor for help.Your school or college probably has an official handbook. It explains how to do APA citations.Go to OWL // Purdue Writing Lab. There are excellent examples and explanations.Go to your school library. Librarians are citation experts.
